PageTitle: hierarchy-convergence base-route hierarchy-route (BGP-IPv6 unicast address family view)
FuncDef:
The hierarchy-convergence base-route hierarchy-route command configures base routes and hierarchical routes.
The undo hierarchy-convergence base-route hierarchy-route cancels the configuration. The hierarchy-convergence base-route hierarchy-route command configures base routes and hierarchical routes. The undo hierarchy-convergence base-route hierarchy-route cancels the configuration. By default, base routes and hierarchical routes are not configured. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: undo hierarchy-convergence base-route <ipv6-address> <ipv6-mask-length> hierarchy-route { all | route-policy <policy-name> }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address of a base route.
The value is in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the mask length of a base route.
It is an integer ranging from 1 to 128.

All routes without the hierarchical convergence attribute will be mapped to the current base route.
-

Routes that do not carry the hierarchical convergence attribute and match the route-policy are mapped to the current base route.
The name is a string of 1 to 200 case-sensitive characters, with spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.
